arrayMethods.title: Array length
arrayMethods.paragraph: The length property returns the length (size) of an array:

arrayMethods.title: Array toString
arrayMethods.paragraph: The JavaScript method toString() converts an array to a string of (comma separated) array values.

arrayMethods.title: Array join
arrayMethods.subtitle: The join() method also joins all array elements into a string.
arrayMethods.paragraph: It behaves just like toString(), but in addition you can specify the separator. the arr: [cacao, banane, lait, vanille]

arrayMethods.title: Array pop
arrayMethods.subtitle: The join() method also joins all array elements into a string.
arrayMethods.paragraph: It behaves just like toString(), but in addition you can specify the separator. The arr: [cacao, banane, lait, vanille]

arrayMethods.title: Array push
arrayMethods.paragraph: The push() method adds a new element to an array (at the end): The arr: [cacao, banane, lait, vanille]

arrayMethods.title: Array shift
arrayMethods.paragraph: The shift() method removes the first array element and 'shifts' all other elements to a lower index. The arr: [cacao, banane, lait, vanille]

arrayMethods.title: Array unshift
arrayMethods.subtitle: The unshift() method adds a new element to an array (at the beginning), and 'unshifts' older elements:

arrayMethods.title: Array concat
arrayMethods.subtitle: The concat() method does not change the existing arrays. It always returns a new array and can take any number of arr arguments.

arrayMethods.title: Array copyWithin
arrayMethods.subtitle: The copyWithin() method copies array elements to another position in an array, can take as second argument the length of the copy.
arrayMethods.paragraph: Type the number(only one number) to chose to copy(contained in the arr length), the index of the copy is : 0. The arr: [cacao, banane, lait, vanille]:

arrayMethods.title: Array Array flat
arrayMethods.subtitle: The flat() method creates a new array with sub-array elements concatenated to a specified depth.(change multiple arr into one, at one level)
arrayMethods.paragraph: Type the number(only one number) to chose to copy(contained in the arr length), the index of the copy is : 0. The arr: [cacao, banane, lait, vanille]:

arrayMethods.title: Array Array splice
arrayMethods.subtitle: The splice() method can be used to add new items to an array or remove them (modify the original array):
arrayMethods.paragraph: The first parameter (2) defines the position where new elements should be added and the second how many element to remove. The rest of parameter define the element to add, if empty it's just remove element. </br> Type the element to add:

arrayMethods.title: Array Array toSpliced
arrayMethods.subtitle: ES2023 added the Array toSpliced() method as a safe way to splice an array without altering the original array.
arrayMethods.paragraph: Same ad splice() but create a new array, and don't save the data removed like splice(). Keeping the original array unchanged

arrayMethods.title: Array Array Array slice
arrayMethods.subtitle: The slice() method slices out a piece of an array into a new array:
arrayMethods.paragraph: The slice() method can take two arguments, the start argument, and up to (but not including) the end argument.</br> The arr: [cacao, banane, lait, vanille]:
